message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with error-correcting codes and their decoding algorithms, which are typically studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Data Structures (cs.DS) sub-categories. The use of polynomial interpolation and linear algebraic techniques suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) and Computational Geometry (cs.CG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper mentions the advantages of the proposed algorithm for unique decoding in the presence of side information, which could be relevant to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category.
